SEC. 5. CENTRALIZED COMPLAINT AND CONSUMER EDUCATION SERVICE FOR VICTIMS OF IDENTITY THEFT. The Federal Trade Commission will establish procedures within a year to log complaints from individuals who believe their identification has been stolen, provide information to these individuals, and refer complaints to relevant entities including consumer reporting agencies and law enforcement for potential action. The Federal Trade Commission will refer complaints of identity theft to appropriate law enforcement agencies for potential action. Authorization of appropriations is provided for this purpose. SEC. 7. Redaction of ethics reports filed by judicial officers and employees. Section 105(b) of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 is amended to allow for redaction of reports filed by certain individuals if revealing personal information could endanger them. The redaction is only permitted to protect the individual and must be maintained as long as the danger exists. The Administrative Office of the United States Courts is required to submit an annual report on the operation of this provision to the Committees on the Judiciary of the House of Representatives and the Senate.
